info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 7:28PM CDT until August 12 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Uvalde.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 728 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Deep Creek, Honey Creek, Sabinal River, Rancheros Creek, Cooks Slough, Onion Creek, Bear Creek, Sycamore Creek, Little Blanco Creek, Salt Creek, Bailey Creek, Hackberry Creek, Mouser Creek, Brushy Creek, Little Indian Creek, Comanche Creek, Dinner Creek, Taylor Slough, Frio River, Blanco Creek, Elm Creek, Indian Creek, Dry Frio River, Leona River, Fush Creek and Nolton Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sabinal, Concan, Knippa and Reagan Wells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
